briefdescription.para: Create a type erased device array from a view.

detaileddescription.para: Copies the data from the view into the new device array

parameterdescription.para: Handle for accessing resources
Type erased device array view to copy from
Pointer to the location to store the pointer to the device array
Pointer to an error object storing details of any error. Will be populated if error code is not CUGRAPH_SUCCESS

memberdef.argsstring: (const cugraph_resource_handle_t *handle, size_t n_elems, cugraph_data_type_id_t dtype, cugraph_type_erased_device_array_t **array, cugraph_error_t **error)

briefdescription.para: Copy data between two type erased device array views.

Pointer to type erased device array view destination
Pointer to type erased device array view source
Pointer to an error object storing details of any error. Will be populated if error code is not CUGRAPH_SUCCESS

briefdescription.para: Create a type erased device array view with a different type.

detaileddescription.para: Create a type erased device array view from a type erased device array treating the underlying pointer as a different type.

Note: This is only viable when the underlying types are the same size. That is, you can switch between INT32 and FLOAT32, or between INT64 and FLOAT64. But if the types are different sizes this will be an error.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the type erased device array
The type to cast the pointer to
Address where to put the allocated device view
Pointer to an error object storing details of any error. Will be populated if error code is not CUGRAPH_SUCCESS
